response.reasoning: The word 'among' is used correctly in this context to denote a consensus within a group.
NASA is an acronym and should always be capitalised.
While 'groupwork' is acceptable, 'group work' (two words) is more commonly preferred in UK English for clarity.
The hyphenation is correct as it is part of a URL, where hyphens are used to separate words.
While 'roleplay' is acceptable, 'role-play' (hyphenated) is often preferred as a compound noun or adjective in formal UK English.
As a compound adjective modifying 'diary entries/news reports', 'first-hand' should be hyphenated.
The correct compound noun is 'riverside' written as a single word.
'Organisation' is the correct UK English spelling, which is appropriate for a WJEC document.
The compound noun 'seawater' should be written as a single word.
'Aeroplanes' is the standard UK English spelling, whereas 'airplanes' is the American English variant.
